thread.title: Heat relief on the way, with cooler temps over next few days in the Mid-South
thread.title_full: Heat relief on the way, with cooler temps over next few days in the Mid-South

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Heat relief on the way, with cooler temps over next few days in the Mid-South
text:
11 hours ago MEMPHIS, Tenn. - We will begin to see a break from the extreme heat and humidity we have felt over the last couple of weeks.
It will remain warm and muggy but with chances for rain and some breezy conditions mixed in.
HERE IS WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW Scattered showers and thunderstorms overnight into Friday morning Severe weather threat is low. Warm but less humidity over the weekend. More storms possible next week Tracking Beryl as it moves into the Gulf of Mexico HERE IS THE FORECAST
FRIDAY: Scattered thunderstorms in the morning that will be giving way to a mix of sun and clouds later in the day. Staying warm but the humidity will not be as high. High of 90 degrees. Winds NW 5-10 mph. SATURDAY: Mostly sunny. Warm and muggy. High of 90 degrees. Winds N 5-10 mph. SUNDAY: Mostly sunny and warm. Humidity remains lower. High of 92 degrees. Winds E 5-10 mph. MONDAY: Chance for scattered showers and thunderstorms. High of 91 degrees. Winds E 5-10 mph. Master Trending Code 36
